meanings.definition: Hagrode (verb): to move or progress slowly and laboriously
meanings.sent1: The old turtle hagrode across the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: The snail hagrode along the garden path.
meanings.sent3: The sloth hagrode to the finish line in the slowest race ever.
meanings.sent4: Time hagrode forward, dragging its feet like a tired traveler.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack hagrode on the tired shoulders of the hiker.

meanings.definition: Hagrode (adjective): showing signs of wear or decay
meanings.sent1: The hagrode book had torn pages and a faded cover.
meanings.sent2: The hagrode house had peeling paint and a sagging roof.
meanings.sent3: The hagrode car sputtered and coughed as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The hagrode tree stood with twisted branches and withered leaves.
meanings.sent5: The hagrode bridge creaked under the weight of each passing car.

meanings.definition: Hagrode (noun): a person who is unpleasant or disagreeable
meanings.sent1: The old man was known as the neighborhood hagrode.
meanings.sent2: The grumpy customer at the store was a true hagrode.
meanings.sent3: The hagrode at the party complained about everything, even the music.
meanings.sent4: The office hagrode made everyone's day gloomy with constant complaints.
meanings.sent5: The hagrode in the movie was the character everyone loved to hate.
